Event.name: Releasing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Captor</fen> ends the captivity or inhibition of the motion of a <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Location_of_confinement</fen>. The release is in accord with the plans of the <fen>Captor</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Captor">They</fex> <t>released</t> <fex name="Theme">me</fex> <fex name="Location_of_confinement">from prison</fex> <fex name="Time">on New Year's Day</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Captor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Captor</fen> is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the <fen>Theme</fen>. The release of the <fen>Theme</fen> is in accord with the plans of the <fen>Captor</fen>.
<ex><fex name="cap">The police</fex> <t>released</t> the suspect.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the person or object in motion released by the <fen>Captor</fen>.
<ex>The police <t>released</t> <fex name="Theme">the suspect</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the release which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Captor</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>The police <t>released</t> the suspect <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action of the <fen>Captor</fen> which brings about the release.
<ex>He <t>released</t> a hundred prisoners <fex name="Means">by signing a single document.</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> identifies the reason for which the <fen>Captor</fen> are releasing the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>The police <t>released</t> the suspect <fex name="Explanation"> because he had a good alibi</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Captor</fen> release the <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ceases to be confined.
<ex>"Aren't you going to <t>release</t> us <fex name="Place">here</fex>?" she asked.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Location_of_confinement
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion was formerly inhibited.
<ex>She petitioned unsuccessfully for their <t>release</t> <fex name="Loc">from Chateau D'If</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Concessive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world when the Releasing event occurs. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: let go.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: allow someone or something to go free

lexUnit.name: release.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of setting free
